comments: Please add the ability to create new Trac tickets using the rich editor.

Steffen: do you plan on doing this for the next release?  That's likely happening next Friday, but not settled yet.

The additional benefit to doing this is that it will generalize the common functionality in NewBugzillaTaskEditor which will benefit the Tasks framework.
I'd love to get this into the next release. I'll look into this early next week and let you know how if it will be ready in time.
*** Bug 159225 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I am a bit lost here. I have implemented the new task editor (based on the Bugzilla one) and added an extension org.eclipse.ui.editors. The id is org.eclipse.mylar.trac.ui.newBugEditor and the class is org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.ui.editor.NewTracTaskEditor. When I invoke 

 TaskUiUtil.openEditor(editorInput, TracUiPlugin.NEW_BUG_EDITOR_ID, page);

I get the error below. Any hints what I am missing?

Oops, forgot to provide the icon attribute, Now the editor shows up.

Note that we currently have a problem with editors not being restored correctly on restart (related to bug 145686).  It will be fixed in the next day or so, but for now just close any editors that fail to load on restart.

Created an attachment (id=52180)
Patch for creating new Trac tasks in rich editor

The patch generalizes NewBugEditor for reuse by other connectors.
Steffen: I'm getting a conflict on this patch, could you re-create?

Created an attachment (id=52187)
Updated patch

Rob, please take a look at AbstractNewRepositoryTaskEditor, it contains most of the code from NewBugEditor and is meant as the common super class for editors that create new tasks. It seems like we could reuse even more code but I think this patch is a good start. Once NewBugEditor is refactored to extend AbstractNewRepositoryTaskEditor it should be clearer what remains to be done there.

Patch applied, great stuff Steffen.  Note that icons do not come across in patches, so you will need to overwrite the icon for the editor in ..mylar.trac.ui.  Also, I don't think that you need the wizard page indicating that a rich editor will open?  But if our API forces that currently, which I vaguely recall it might, it's fine to leave for now.
According to bug 147540 it is not possible for a MultiRepositoryAwareWizard to finish on the first page.
Icon comitted. Marking as fixed as feature has been implemented. We can open up a new report for the remaining refactoring.
I'm just about done the refactoring and will commit the changes commit under this report.
